availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Newton Whitaker (Harrison County, Kentucky farmer and soldier)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah J. Rankin Whitaker in Harrison County, Kentucky on September 4, 1856. Father of Willis R. Whitaker, John A. Whitaker, and Nancy E. Whitaker. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 40th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private and as a 2nd Lieutenant from July 4, 1863 to January 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 661.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216888, p.53 of microfilm.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 435.
1890 Veteran's ScheduleHarrison County, Kentucky, p. 2.
Find A Grave, "Isaac Newton Whitaker (May 30, 1832-Jul 22, 1894)," Memorial #46611886, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46611886 (accessed June 18, 2020).
